Memorandum by tho Minister of Health.With reference to Cabinet Conclusion 7(a) of the 3rd of August as to Housing in England, I have now to report th&t the Chancellor of the Exchequer and myself have agreed that action in regard to the subsidy shall be taken as proposed In my Memorandum CP.290(26), except that the subsidy in respect of houses completed after the 1st October,1927, under the Wheatley Act of 1924 will be reduced by 1.10.0d, Instead of by 1. I am arranging to meet the associations of local authorities at an early date and to inform them of what is proposed. The Order required under the Act of 1924 will then be made and laid before Parliament as soon as possible,I have not yet reached complete agreement with the Chancellor upon the administrative action described in the memorandum but I propose to discuss this further with him as soon as I return to London when no doubt we shall be able to reach a conclusion satisfactory to both of us.(Intld). W.C.21st October, 1926.
